title: Tanzanite
shortDesc: Santiago who travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried near the Pyramids. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elitet.
LongDesc: A beautiful and rare blue-violet gemstone that is found exclusively in the Merelani Hills of northern Tanzania, East Africa. It's a variety of the mineral zoisite and is known for its stunning blue and violet colors, often with a hint of purple. Tanzanite is one of the most sought-after gemstones due to its unique color and limited geographic source.

title: Cassiterite
shortDesc: Santiago who travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried near the Pyramids. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elitet.
LongDesc:
This story, dazzling in its powerful simplicity and soul-stirring wisdom, is about an Andalusian shepherd boy named Santiago who travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried near the Pyramids. Lorem ipsum dolor sit.

**Features & functionality**
- High quality certified organic cotton
- Loopback sweat
- Fixed hood lined in main fabric
- Dropped shoulder seam
- Pouch pocket with jersey lining
- Signature “A” cut line on the back
- 1/1 rib at hem and sleeves
- 5cm logo embroidery at center front upper chest
- Unisex fit

*This story, dazzling in its powerful simplicity and soul-stirring wisdom, is about an Andalusian shepherd boy named Santiago who travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried near the Pyramids. Lorem ipsum dolor sit.*

title: Beryl
shortDesc: Beryl is a mineral composed of beryllium aluminium cyclosilicate, and it forms a family of gemstones with varying colors due to the presence of trace elements. Some of the most well-known varieties of beryl include emerald (green), aquamarine (blue to blue-green), heliodor (yellow to yellow-green), morganite (pink to peach), and goshenite (colorless). Beryl is found in various parts of the world, and there are several important beryl deposits in Africa.
LongDesc: Beryl is a mineral composed of beryllium aluminium cyclosilicate, and it forms a family of gemstones with varying colors due to the presence of trace elements. Some of the most well-known varieties of beryl include emerald (green), aquamarine (blue to blue-green), heliodor (yellow to yellow-green), morganite (pink to peach), and goshenite (colorless). Beryl is found in various parts of the world, and there are several important beryl deposits in Africa.
